alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 3:47PM EDT until March 24 at 1:56AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek Above Findlay affecting Hancock County. For the Eagle Creek (Hancock)...including Findlay...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek Above Findlay. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Eagle Creek will overrun its banks and begin to inundate portions of Fremont and Graceland Avenue. Water will inundate a field near Rosemont Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM EDT Thursday was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. The river may rise back above flood stage Saturday morning due to additional rainfall. Stay tuned for more information. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM EDT.
